{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.13096v1", "title": "Tight and overtwisted contact structures", "summary": "The tight versus overtwisted dichotomy has been an essential organizing
principle and driving force in 3-dimensional contact geometry since its
inception around 1990. In this article, we will discuss the genesis of this
dichotomy in Eliashberg's seminal work and his influential contributions to the
theory.", "main_category": "math.SG", "categories": "math.SG,math.GT", "published": "2025-04-17T17:06:39Z"}
